title: Special Event: Slow Art Day
description:
Discover what happens when you visit the galleries and take time to look at a work of art for a longer period of time. Experience the collection in new and unexpected ways on your own and then engage with young people from the Art Institute’s youth programs around the experience.

When you arrive, check in at the Slow Art Day information table in the Modern Wing's Griffin Court for further details on the day's events.

The day's featured artworks include:

Ernst Ludwig Kirchner's Apparition of the Seven Deadly Sins, Gallery 392

Alma Thomas's Starry Night and the Astronauts, Gallery 297

Marc Chagall's America Windows, Gallery 144

Glenn Ligon's Stranger in the Village #13, Gallery 289

Winslow Homer's The Herring Net, Gallery 171

Frans Snyders's Still Life with Dead Game, Fruits, and Vegetables in a Market, Gallery 208

Children under 14 and Chicago youth under 18 always receive free museum admission.
buy_button_caption:
Free with museum admission, no registration required
Drop in 11:00 a.m.–2:00 p.m.
